entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP BTP - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP BTP continues to evolve and expand, offering our customers improved resources and streamlined access to product updates.

With the Q3 2025 update, we ensured all content is up-to-date and we are excited to announce the addition of a new product page for SAP Customer Data Solutions as well as some cosmetic UI updates. Read more about the details in this blog post.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Collaborating closely with SAP BTP experts, we've expanded the release coverage by introducing 11 new product pages. These pages compile links to all available release information, such as schedules, pre- and post-release communications, blogs, and more:

  • SAP Customer Data Solutions, including
    • SAP Customer Data Cloud / SAP Customer Identity and Access Management
    • SAP Customer Data Platform

Read on to see what you can find on this new page.

SAP Customer Data Solutions

This page contains specific resources for SAP Customer Identity and Access Management, SAP Customer Data Platform, as well as release resources relevant across different SAP Customer Data Solutions. Here’s a list of all you can find on this page:

  • SAP Customer Identity and Access Management (CDC)
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • SAP Customer Data Platform
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • General Customer Data Solutions Resources
    • SAP BTP Newsletter
    • Enablement Webcasts
    • Subscription link to Cloud Availability Center

Please Note: This page has previously been available via the Release Navigator for Customer Experience. Adding this page to the Release Navigator for SAP BTP reflects the move of SAP Customer Data Solutions from the Customer Experience area to SAP BTP. The page in the Release Navigator for Customer Experience will stay online until the beginning of Q4 2025 for everyone to take note and switch out their potential bookmarks or saved links. After that, only the page within the Release Navigator for SAP BTP will remain available.

Check it out.

 

 

With this last round of updates, we added new visual elements to all release navigators. The UI updates in the Release Navigator for SAP BTP do not affect functionality or performance and are strictly cosmetical.

On the home page also known as the Product Specific page, you will notice that our Welcome and Release Calendar cards have received a facelift for a fresher look and feel. 

On all pages where you can open informational text boxes by hovering over the lightbulb icon, you will see a slight update to the design of these boxes. Content and functionality remain the same. 

As a reminder: These pop-up boxes show up on every page with a lightbulb icon at the top and may be moved around on the page or closed once you are done reading them.

 

 

For centralized information regarding the release of new features for SAP BTP products and services, consult the Consolidated Release Schedule for SAP BTP.

Regarding the Release Navigator updates, refer to this update plan:

*Disclaimer: The schedule is subject to alterations without notice, including potential delays or the integration of changes in subsequent update windows. It doesn't establish a commitment, promise, or legal duty to deliver any material, code, or functionality. Looking into the remaining quarters of 2025, updates will focus on quarterly content maintenance and a steady extension of product coverage. No substantial UI updates are planned for the time being.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale team within SAP Enterprise Support is driven to ensure release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to effectively adopt and utilize innovations.

If you have feedback or specific requests for content within the release navigator, feel free to contact us.

Don't forget to explore our team’s blogs tagged under Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale  
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Re: [ABAP 7.4] : What is the new program to change released task to unreleased ?
entry.content:
The note mentioned 3132029 cannot be accessed via OSS anymore.... But:

On SolMan it should be possible to delete the ChaRM there (leaving an orhpaned TR in the connected SAP system with a released task). Via SE16, debug to EDIT or DELETE mode change of E070 it should be possible to:

  1. Delete the Transport of Copies task
  2. Change the status of the released task from R (released) to D (changes possible)

After that, SE01 or SE10 should be sufficient to delete the request/task as per usual if the task would not have been released before.

entry.title: Re: User ID for IAS users
entry.content: Hi The EmployeeID only makes sense if you only use employees in your BTP solutions. Most companies have External users or even scenarios with B2B cases. The UUID is inteneded to be the long term solution and has a specific format. mapping the EmployeeID there is incorrect because it won't respect the intended format. Agree with Mathias that some solutions still don't support it but there you can use some additional IAS attribute as of now.

entry.title: I would like to understand where the tax information comes from when avalara is integrated with SAP
entry.content:
We have integrated SAP with Avalara .
I would like to understand where the tax information comes from when PERSON_NAME is integrated with SAP. My understanding is that once we integrate SAP with PERSON_NAME, taxi information or Tax data (or Tax determiantion) in documents like Contracts , Sales orders and Customer Inovoices comes from Avalara. Please confirm if my understanding is correct here?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: I would like to understand where the tax information...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

Avalara AvaTax(Tax Rate Determination Service Provider), maintain tax rates, applicable on sale or purchase of goods and services across the jurisdictions in the US in their side. 

Once you integrate SAP with Avalara, taxi information or Tax data (or Tax determination) in documents like Contracts , Sales orders and Customer Invoices comes from Avalara. 

Best Regards, 

Arjun T H 

SAP Product Support

entry.title: Re: Reconciliation Account selection in "Create Supplier...
entry.content:
Hello @Kazuhiro_F 

Thank you for sharing the screenshots. I understand why there was confusion.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the reconciliation account for supplier invoices is typically derived from the supplier master data and cannot be modified during the invoice posting process. The behaviour you noticed in one system, where you can select the reconciliation account manually, usually happens under these circumstances

  • The supplier is set up as a one-time vendor account group that permits reconciliation account entry.
  • The reconciliation account is not kept in the supplier master, leaving the field blank when posting.
  • Field status configuration through SSCUI 150001 or related settings permits optional entry.

For standard suppliers, it is best practice to assign a fixed reconciliation account in the master data to ensure accurate reconciliation between the subledger and general ledger. Editable reconciliation accounts should be used only in one-time vendor situations.

I recommend examining the supplier account group and reconciliation account configurations in both systems to understand why editing is allowed in one but not the other.

SAP Help Portal – Create Supplier Invoice (F0859)

SAP Help Portal – Supplier Master Data and Reconciliation Accounts

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: To close old STOs with open archived OBDs that have b...
entry.content:
Some of the workarounds when OBDs are archived

1. Unarchive Temporarily (if policy allows).
If your organization permits it, you can temporarily reload the archived delivery using transaction SARI or via Archive Information System. Once restored, you can reverse PGI using VL09, adjust the STO accordingly. After corrections, the delivery can be re-archived. This requires coordination with your BASIS team and may not be feasible in tightly controlled environments.

2. Manual Closure via ME22N
If reversal isn’t possible, you can manually set the “Delivery Completed” indicator in ME22N for the STO line item. This tells the system that no further deliveries or GRs are expected. You may also need to adjust the open quantity to match the delivered quantity if the system blocks the flag due to mismatch.

3. Custom Program or BAPI
Some companies develop a custom report or BAPI-based tool to mass-close STOs with archived deliveries. These tools bypass standard checks and update the delivery completion flag or final delivery status directly in the backend.

4. Accounting Adjustments
If the goods were never received and cannot be reversed, consider posting a manual write-off to a loss account or cost center. This is often done via MB1A with movement type 551 (scrapping) or similar.

entry.title: Re: SQL Anywhere: Problem with JSON data with German umla...
entry.content:
Thanks for the quick response, John - and the hint to a different collation. I cannot currently change the database collation but will be careful in that respect.
As a workaround I will replace the possibly misinterpreted \uxxxx escape sequences with the actual characters (typically umlauts) when they are followed by two hex digits - and do that before sp_parse_json() is called. This should work as long as they are available in our charset.

entry.title: Service contract determination on service orders
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm using the API Service Order A2X (API_SERVICE_ORDER_SRV) to migrate service orders from external systems to S/4HANA Public Cloud. There are some orders which I don't want to link to service contracts, but if I don't, there'll be errors on the UI.

Is there a way to select if I don't want service contract determination in a specific order?

Thank you, best regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Service contract determination on service orders
entry.content:
Hello,

On the payload for the service order, on item level, you can include the field SrvcContrDetnIsSpprsd, it indicates that the service contract determination is suppressed in the service order item. Check the documentation Service Order Items | SAP Help Portal

It's also possible to configure the service contract determination through this configuration activity: 'Specify Contract Determination Option for Trans. Types' (ID: 103686).

Kind regards.

entry.title: Re: BAdI is internal SAP; implementation in customer namespace not allowed
entry.content:
• You cannot implement BADI in Z: it is blocked by design.

  • Recommended solution: find a released BAdI for Batch Management via SE18.

  • If not available: use an enhancement point in the standard (with caution).

entry.title: Re: Hard currency values as realtime posting in asset dep...
entry.content:
Dear Ronaldo

No, activating hard currency real-time posting for ledger L1 only will not affect other ledgers (0L, T1) as long as depreciation areas are carefully mapped per ledger group. The only effect is in ACDOCA entries and reporting, where you will see explicit TRY postings for L1.

Have you tried the following?

In FI-AA IMG:
SPRO → Financial Accounting → Asset Accounting → Valuation → Currencies → Specify Depreciation Areas for Foreign Currencies

Create a depreciation area linked to Hard Currency (40).

Set it as real-time posting.

Assign it to ledger group L1 only.

In Depreciation Area → Ledger Assignment:

Ensure hard currency depreciation area is not assigned to 0L and T1.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Assertion Faileure 201503

entry.title: Re: S/4 Hana Extensibility Service Instance
entry.content:
Hello @Dipto_Arafat 

The S/4HANA Public Cloud service binding is necessary, as it provides your BTP app with trusted endpoints and credentials for a secure connection to SAP S/4HANA Cloud. While the XSUAA binding secures your app's users, the S4-HANA Public Cloud binding facilitates system-to-system integration through API calls and events. The Destination service stores the runtime connection details used by your code.

For side-by-side extension using TypeScript and SAP Cloud SDK, the process is as follows:

  1. Create a communication arrangement in S/4HANA Cloud.
  2. Create and bind S4 HANA Cloud, XSUAA, and Destination services in BTP.
  3. Configure a Destination to the S/4HANA API.
  4. Download the EDMX from SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  5. Use Cloud SDK to generate TypeScript client code.
  6. In your app, call the API via the generated client — the SDK reads the Destination at runtime.

Brief

  • XSUAA → secures the app (users).
  • s4-hana-cloud → secures the S/4HANA Cloud link.
  • Destination → holds API endpoint/auth for runtime use.

Check below SAP documentation

  • SAP Cloud SDK for JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Learning Journey – Develop Extensions with SAP Cloud SDK
  • SAP Business Accelerator Hub

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: FMS In Good Issue
entry.content: @Felipe_Lima but the problem is it would mean updating the FMS query everytime I add new expense accounts.Can you explain this statement in maybe simple way.'This happens because cost centres are bound to the GL in the setting "relevant for cost accounting". BS accounts ideally won't be cost-relevant, so CC fields are "nulled" by SAP. P&L GLs tend to be cost-relevant, so SAP will try to pick the CC from there. If it is null, SAP does the same as the BS, if not, the CC will be pulled from there. ".i am confused as a beginner. Thanks

entry.title: Re: Missing Document Generation Option in Profile
entry.content: Kindly refer to this article: 2310843 - Document Generation: Unable to 'Generate Document' as Self Service (MSS/ESS).

entry.title: Re: FMS In Good Issue
entry.content:
Hi @user2001 ,

I understand your pain. The hardcoded value FMS is not a dynamic choice, indeed. I've used user-defined tables for such purposes many times, and I think it is the best approach without going further with coding. So you would have a table where all GL to CC mapping is kept, and your FMS would look up values on this table, which streamlines maintenance a lot.

Regarding SAP's behaviour, have a look at how GLs are set up in the Chart of Accounts. When an account is of the type "other", it's understood as a Balance Sheet GL (BS), where typically there is no cost assignment, although you may keep a GL in the BS structure of your CoA and set it up as "Expense" or "Sales", which basically tells SAP you want to enable cost assignment. This is a business decision and must be studied to understand the impacts.

 

Either way, when you call an GL in the document, SAP will try to get the CC from the CoA setup. For example, if in your case, 5001014 GL has ABC-1234 defaulted to one cost dimension, selecting this account will make SAP enforce this default value and fetch ABC-1234. If there is no CC default, it will enforce NULL (no value), that's why your field gets emptied after the FMS is triggered, as the GL gets populated. 

I hope it makes sense.


BR,
Felipe

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: Site Improvements, New Badges, and Hot Content
entry.content:
If you’re a What’s New regular, you know we’ve been busy since our last newsletter edition on August 15. We’ve launched new progression badge sets (with more coming in September), made several site improvements, and announced a redesign pilot for blog posts.

If you missed those updates, we summarize them for your convenience below. We also highlight popular blog posts from SAP and non-SAP members, introduce new groups and topic pages, and cover upcoming events.

Read on to learn more!

 

Featured Content

 

ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

SAP’s @OlgaDolinskaja gives a breakdown of new clean-core extensibility guidance and explains how the ABAP extensibility guide has been updated with guidelines that align with and support the clean-core level concept for the classification of custom extensions. You won’t want to miss this post and its lively thread! 

Read the blog post

 

Introducing the New AI Adapter for SAP Integration Suite

@Punith_Oswal, one of our SAP Champions, has a question for you: Have you ever wished that your iFlow could talk to ChatGPT? If you answered yes, you’ll want to take some time out of your day to read this post. And if you answered no, I still feel pretty positive you’ll enjoy this contribution.

Read the blog post

 

New Series: SAP UX Q3/2025 Updates

A new series from SAP’s @ThomasReiss provides an overview of user experience innovations in the cloud from the last six months, covering the whole portfolio, such as AI and Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and SAP SuccessFactors, as well as detailing innovations in SAP’s UI technologies for building great UX.

Start with the first post, which contains links to the entire series

 

SAP Cloud Application Programming Model with Local App Previews

I’m happy to see our SAP Champions have been so active with their blogging this month! @MioYasutake has written a short blog post detailing experiences while trying out virtual endpoints with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model with Node.js. The post covers findings while testing local previews.

Read the blog post

 

Community News

 

Badges, Badges, and More Badges!

Long-time SAP Community members may remember the days when they could earn sets of badges for ongoing positive contributions. Well, we’ve brought these progression badges back! This week, we rolled out four new badges based on the number of kudos received. Last week we assigned badges for providing solutions to questions. And there are more badges coming in the weeks ahead. With these badges, we’re once again recognizing active members and encouraging everyone to make our community a better place by participating more frequently. Make sure to subscribe to What’s New so you won’t miss more badge announcements next month!

 

New Features: Dark Mode (Beta) and Events Listings

A beta version of dark mode is available for SAP Community, and our events listings now include additional filtering options that make it easier for you to find activities of interest to you. You can learn more about these two new features in this post. Experiment with dark mode/light mode to see which presentation works best for you, and try out the various new event filters to find educational and social get-togethers in your area that appeal to you.

 

Your Feedback Wanted for New Design Pilot

We’re currently running a pilot to test a new layout for blog posts that removes widgets and white space from the right column – based on a feature request from members who asked us to improve the readability of these pages. You can learn more about this pilot in this post, and we’re inviting members to share their opinions in the comments there. The pilot concludes on Tuesday, September 23, so please leave your input there before then.

 

New Location Groups Now Available

We’ve launched (or renamed) three location groups. Our Brazilian members continue to expand our groups in the Americas – with the recent addition of Joinville. Over in the Europe section, the former ’s-Hertogenbosch group has switched its name to The Netherlands to accommodate more members in that country. Elsewhere in Europe, we’ve introduced the Düsseldorf-Köln group to bring together members from those cities. If you’re from one of these areas, you’ll want to join the corresponding group so you can connect with members close to you.

 

Upcoming Events

 

Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki

@TammyPowlas, part of our SAP Mentors program, has referred to the upcoming SAP TechEd event as a family reunion, and so it’s no surprise she’s showing familial-type support for another SAP Mentor, @Marla-Schwaiki (whom we mentioned in the last edition of SAP Community Voice). In this post, Tammy explains why you should attend Marla’s community talk in Berlin. We love seeing members supporting members, so if you’re planning to attend SAP TechEd, please make sure to include Marla’s session in your schedule.

 

Find Meetup Events in Your Region

In the last two SAP Community Voice newsletters, we’ve focused on SAP CodeJam events, but as explained earlier in this edition, our events listings have been expanded to include filters for finding a variety of local activities. Therefore, I’d like to use this edition to draw attention to meetups (also known as SAP Stammtisch events in Germany) in September. Next month, you can socialize with members in Wien (Austria), Gurugram (India), Casablanca (Morocco), Dortmund (Germany), Cyprus (Greece), Brussels (Belgium), Warsaw (Poland), Lingen (Germany), Bamberg (Germany), Hamburg (Germany), Porto (Portugal), Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil), and Luzern (Switzerland). You can find a full list of events here. Make sure to register for an event near you!

entry.title: Browser Content Area in Enable Now is capturing entire browser
entry.content: For the past week or so, we've been experiencing an issue where selecting Browser Content Area (as we always have) is capturing the entire browser (similar to Active Window) and not just the content. This happens in both Chrome and Edge...I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling the extensions, clearing the browser cache and cookies, but nothing has worked...I'd guess this was due to a browser update, but for it to happen in both browsers makes it seem unlikely. For the time being, we are using the Region option and manually sizing the capture area to fit the content. This is causing much frustration in our projects and we are desperately trying to find a solution for this.

entry.title: Making Sense of Sales Org Structures in SAP: Sales, Sales Org, Sales Office, and Sales Group
entry.content:
When you first look at sales structures in SAP, the terms can feel like they’re all saying the same thing. Sales Org, Sales Office, Sales Group, Sales Unit—it’s easy to get lost. Let’s break it down in a way that actually makes sense.

1. Sales Org, Sales Office, Sales Group – the classics
Think of these as the traditional building blocks. They’ve been around in ERP and S/4 forever, and they have specific meanings:

  • Sales Organization: The top level. Usually tied to a country or a large region, like “Germany Sales Org.” It’s also important in transactions (pricing, master data, sales orders, etc.).

  • Sales Office: A sub-level, often representing a physical office, like “Berlin Sales Office.”

  • Sales Group: Even more granular, like “North Berlin Sales Group” inside that office.

These units are embedded into the system. They show up in transactions, master data, and user assignments. If a sales rep is tied to a Sales Group, that info automatically flows into quotes, orders, and reporting.

2. Sales Unit – the flexible layer
Now here’s the modern twist: Sales Unit is like a flexible overlay that lets you model your structure more creatively. It’s not bound by the strict definitions of Org, Office, or Group.

Why use it?

  • You want reporting across multiple orgs (e.g., “Europe Sales” across five countries).

  • You want to add dimensions that aren’t in your backend (e.g., splitting one office into “Internet Sales” vs. “Direct Sales”).

  • You want to restructure without touching the ERP backbone.

In short: Sales Units let you go beyond the rigid ERP structure.

3. How they work together
Here’s the simplest way to think of it:

  • Sales Org / Office / Group = specific, traditional sales units that matter for master and transaction data.

  • Sales Unit = the superset that gives you finer granularity and flexibility.

When you assign a user to a Sales Unit and they create a sales document (like a quote), the system knows the hierarchy. It pulls in the related Sales Group, Office, and Org automatically.

So what’s the takeaway?

  • If you’re defining legal and transactional structures, stick to Sales Org, Office, and Group.

  • If you’re defining reporting and flexible structures, use Sales Units.

That’s it. No need to overcomplicate. Think of Sales Units as your way to model the real-world sales structure without being trapped by backend constraints.

entry.title: Re: PGI and PGR in Advanced Returns Management (ARM)
entry.content:
Why PGI works differently in ARM is because, in classic returns, the system treats the SD-FC (Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge) order as a standalone replenishment. You can upload stock directly to the SD-FC sales order item and execute PGI without issue.

But in ARM, the SD-FC order is logistically and financially linked to the original return order. This linkage is managed through the follow-up activity and returns document flow, which changes how inventory is tracked and consumed.

What is happening behind the scenes is when you create a return order in ARM, the returned goods are received into blocked stock (typically via movement type 653). The system tracks this blocked stock against the return sales order and item, not the SD-FC order. When you create the SD-FC order, it inherits the reference to the return order. But the system expects the PGI to consume stock from the return order, not from a fresh upload to the SD-FC order. So when you upload stock against the SD-FC order directly, the system doesn’t recognize it as valid for PGI—because it’s not part of the ARM-managed return flow.

What you can do is if you want PGI to work smoothly in ARM:

  • Always upload or adjust stock against the return order and item.
  • Ensure the follow-up activity in the ARM return order is correctly set to “Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge.”
  • Use transaction MSR_INSPWH if inspection is involved, to release stock from blocked to unrestricted before PGI.

When I route between pages, the “The requested page is not available” bypass page briefly appears before the correct page is loaded. This only happens when navigating between subpages. The plugin was uploaded properly as an extension in the POD Designer and was created using the Yeoman Generator.

Here are the most important code snippets:

  • Routing in DetailController.js (3)
  • MainView.view (4)
  • Component.json (5)

Structure:  MainView.view -> Detail.view -> Over.view.

I would appreciate any help or suggestions.

entry.title: Remove Suppress Groovy script for CPI Message Mapping
entry.content:
import com.sap.it.api.mapping.*

def void removeSuppress(String[] values, Output output, MappingContext context) {
def filtered = values.findAll { v -> v != null && !output.isSuppress(v) }
filtered.each { v -> output.addValue(v) }
}

entry.title: Re: SAP public cloud RAP Custom action Print pdf
entry.content:
Hi @JamesG 

To trigger a direct download of a printed Adobe Form (PDF) from the front-end in a RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) Fiori app, instead of just sending it to the print queue, you need to expose the PDF as a stream from your backend action and trigger it from the custom button on your Fiori UI.

Here is the approach I recommend

  • In your RAP behaviour definition (BDEF), ensure the Print action calls the Adobe Form rendering and returns the PDF file content as RAWSTRING (XSTRING).
  • Use Base64 or binary format to transfer the PDF from the ABAP backend to the Fiori front-end.
  • Update your Fiori UI logic so that when the print action is executed, the app receives the file content and opens a browser download using Blob/URL.createObjectURL for binary data.

The following technical steps should support you in that process:

  1. Backend ABAP (RAP) Action:
    • After rendering the Adobe Form, encode the PDF output as Base64 or provide the XSTRING/RAWSTRING in the response payload. An example is to add the file content to an entity or as an action return parameter.
  2. Fiori UI (Front-end):
    • On Print button press, trigger the RAP action and receive the PDF content.
    • Convert Base64/RAWSTRING to blob and use JavaScript to prompt file download or open the PDF directly in a new tab.

Here are some useful References

SAP Q&A: How to create RAP Action to generate a file to download?

Sample workaround for similar download logic.

This process will enable end users to directly download or view the generated PDF from the RAP service without needing to access the print queue.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Massive update the ATP rule in EDE?
entry.content:
Dear

please read SAP Help Wiki: "How to setup an APO‑ATP example"

Yes, you can massively update ATP rules in EDE via LSMW/FM or custom program, and then request a Master Data Transport TR from /SAPAPO/AC42 (Extras → Transport) to move them into GDE.

Do the massive update in EDE via either:

LSMW (using BDC in /SAPAPO/AC42) Or a Z-report using /SAPAPO/RRP_ATP_RULE_SAVE

After update, go to /SAPAPO/AC42 → Extras → Transport, select updated ATP Rules.

This will create a transport request which you can release and move to GDE.

Best regards

entry.title: Multiple Ways to Give Feedback on CAP Documentation
entry.content:
At CAP, we believe great documentation is a collaborative effort. That's why we've built multiple channels for you to share feedback, report issues, and contribute improvements. Whether you spot a typo, need clarification, or want to suggest new content, we've got you covered.

Quick Feedback: "Was This Page Helpful?

The fastest way to give feedback is right at the bottom of every documentation page.

Our "Was This Page Helpful?" widget lets you:

• Give a quick 👍 or 👎 rating.
• Add optional comments (up to 140 characters, dialog opens after you gave a rating).
• Track sentiment without leaving the page.

This feedback is collected anonymously through Matomo analytics and helps us identify which pages need attention. It's perfect for quick reactions and brief improvement suggestions.

Targeted Survey Feedback

For more structured feedback, click the survey icon in the top navigation bar. 

This links to our comprehensive SAP Insights survey where you can:

• Rate different aspects of the documentation.
• Suggest specific improvements.
• Share your overall experience with CAP.
• Provide demographic information to help us understand our audience.

The survey typically takes 5-10 minutes and gives us deeper insights into what's working and what needs improvement. Not only for capire but also for CAP overall.

Issues & Bug Reports: GitHub Issues

Found a problem? Have a feature request? Head to our GitHub Issues page.

This is ideal for:

• Bug reports: Broken links, incorrect code examples, outdated information
• Content requests: Missing documentation, unclear explanations
• Technical issues: Problems with the website functionality
• Enhancement suggestions: Ideas for improving existing content

GitHub Issues provide full transparency - you can see what others have reported and track progress on fixes.

Direct Contributions: Edit This Page

See something that needs a quick fix? At the bottom of every page is an "Edit this page" link that takes you directly to GitHub.

There you can:

• Fix typos and formatting issues.
• Update code examples.
• Add clarifications.
• Improve explanations.

This leverages GitHub's collaborative features. The process is as follows:

1. Fork the repository
2. Make your changes
3. Submit a pull request
4. Get your improvements reviewed and merged

Learning Resources & Community Contributions

We maintain a curated collection of community learning resources. You can nominate blog posts, tutorials, and other content that helped you learn CAP through GitHub Issues. Tag your issue with suggestions for the learning resources page.

Contributing to Open Source Projects

Many CAP components are open source with their own feedback channels:

• CDS Database Services: Feature requests and bug reports for database connectors
• CDS Types: TypeScript declaration improvements
• IntelliJ Plugin: IDE integration feedback

Which Channel Should You Use?

Use the page widget when:

• You want to quickly rate a page.
• You have brief suggestions (under 140 characters).
• You don't need to track the response.

Use the survey when:

• You want to provide comprehensive feedback.
• You have time for a detailed questionnaire.
• You want to influence our documentation strategy.

Use GitHub Issues when:

• You found a bug or technical problem.
• You need to include screenshots or code examples.
• You want to track progress on your request.
• You're suggesting new content or major changes.

Use "Edit this page" when:

• You can fix the issue yourself.
• The change is straightforward (typos, small clarifications).
• You want to contribute directly to the codebase.

What Happens Next?

Your feedback doesn't go into a black hole! Here's how we process it:

1. Page ratings are monitored weekly to identify problematic content.
2. Survey responses inform our quarterly documentation roadmap.
3. GitHub Issues are triaged and assigned to subject matter experts if needed.
4. Pull requests are reviewed by maintainers and merged when appropriate.
5. Community contributions are highlighted in our release notes.

Get Involved!

The CAP documentation is a community effort. Whether you're fixing a typo or contributing a comprehensive guide, every improvement helps thousands of developers worldwide.

Ready to contribute? Start with something small - maybe rate this blog post or leave us a comment. Every
contribution makes CAP better for everyone.

Have ideas for improving our feedback mechanisms? We'd love to hear them! Use any of the channels above to let us know.

entry.title: New feature for the Pipeline for Cloud Integration: custom preprocessing exit
entry.content:
As mentioned in my last blog post New integration packages for the Pipeline for Cloud Integration, we have deprecated the previous package  Process Integration Pipeline - Generic Integration Flows & Templates and have shipped four new packages replacing the deprecated package for supporting the Pipeline for Cloud Integration. You will notice that the previous package has the label [DEPRECATED] in its name now. No worries, you can still run the old package in a transition phase, if you run the latest update you will notice that just the name has been changed. But we encourage you to switch to the new packages, see Pipelines about how to proceed.

One more reason for switching to the new packages, besides the higher flexibility for setting up different pipelines, is that from now on we ship new features in the new packages only. One of the new features that we have lately shipped is the support for custom preprocessing. You have the option to call a custom exit integration flow without having to edit the provided generic flows. To do so, you must implement a separate integration flow that can be called at the very beginning of each generic integration flow. See Custom Preprocessing Exit.

Let me show you how to configure the custom preprocessing. You have two options, either configure it globally, which means that the custom exit integration flow is called for all of your integration scenarios, or configure it scenario-specific. You can even combine both options, having one global custom exit which is applied across all scenarios and in addition calling scenario-specific exit flows for particular scenarios only.

Global setting

To enable custom preprocessing globally, you need to configure each generic integration flow that should call the custom preprocessing flow as follows:

In the configuration, change the value of the parameter CustomXPreGlobal_Enabled from false (which is the default) to true. Furthermore, maintain the ProcessDirect endpoint of your custom exit integration flow in the parameter CustomXPreGlobal_Endpoint, by default the value is /pip/custom/preProcessing/global. You can keep it or change it to your preference. You may then create one custom integration flow for each generic integration flow of the pipeline or use one single custom integration flow across all pipeline steps depending on your requirements. See also below.

Scenario-specific setting

For scenario-specific configuration, you can define for which pipeline steps the custom exit integration flow should be called. For this, you need to add the corresponding string parameters to the scenario in the Partner Directory for which the custom preprocessing should be enabled.

Create a string parameter CustomXPreEnabled where you define the list of pipeline steps which should call the exit flow separated by pipe.

In our example in the screenshot below, we enable custom preprocessing for all pipeline steps:

  • 01 stands for either the generic XI inbound processing or the generic IDoc inbound processing
  • 02 corresponds to either the generic inbound processing flow or the generic integrated messaging runtime
  • 04 corresponds to the generic receiver determination flow
  • 05 corresponds to the generic interface determination flow
  • 06 corresponds to the generic outbound processing flow

If you run through the integrated messaging runtime, which is our recommended pipeline anyway, only step numbers 01, 02, and 06 are relevant. If you only like to run the custom exit flow for the integrated messaging runtime and the generic outbound processing flow for instance, then set the value to 02|06. I think you get the point.

Furthermore, create a string parameter CustomXPreEndpoint, which points to the ProcessDirect endpoint of your custom exit integration flow. Other than for the global setting, here we only support one custom integration flow across all pipeline steps to minimize the configuration effort, but you can have a separate custom integration flow for each scenario. See how we are able to implement pipeline step specific logic below.

Because we only have one custom integration flow for each scenario, we pass the header customXPipelineStep from the generic flows to the custom flow. With this, you have the option to implement pipeline step specific logic based on this very header. You can use a copy of the template Pipeline v2 Template - Custom Exit to model your custom flow. It contains a router with routes for all pipeline steps including corresponding router conditions. To ensure that the header value is present in the custom flow, the header is part of the allowed headers settings. Furthermore, the template adds the pipeline step number to the custom header properties so that you have full transparency in the message monitor about which pipeline step called the exit flow.

From what we heard from customers, potential use cases could be to implement additional external or internal logging capabilities or to stop certain messages from sending to the receiver systems based on some conditions, e.g. maintained in the Partner Directory. So, regardless of your use case, I think with this we have increased the flexibility of the pipeline for Cloud Integration.

entry.title: Re: S/4 Public Cloud ECS - issue with triggering the ECS...
entry.content:
Hi @Kamen 

Thank you for your question. Hope this still provides some insights to your question.

You are correct that the Error Correction System (ECS) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud is enabled via the app Upload Posting Data, Error Correction and Suspense Accounting. The formatting error you are seeing usually occurs when the CSV/XLSX template is not filled exactly according to the defined structure in the SAP-delivered template. Below are a few checks to carry out:

  1. Template Formatting
    • Ensure you are using the latest template downloaded directly from the app. Please note that templates may change after upgrades.
    • All mandatory columns must be filled. Do not rename or delete columns.
    • Pay attention to the correct date format (YYYY-MM-DD) and amount format (decimal separator as per system settings).
  2. Here are some supported File Types
    • Only CSV UTF-8 or the system-generated XLSX is supported. If you edit in Excel and save in another encoding, the system may reject it.
  3. Interfaces
    • ECS can only be triggered from supported postings via APIs and pre-delivered apps. Custom IDocs/BAPIs are not supported in Public Cloud. Make sure you are using the correct API:
      • Journal Entry Post (Asynchronous) [API_JOURNALENTRYBULK_CREATE]
      • If errors are detected, they flow into ECS automatically.
  4. Some known Limitation
    • Currently, ECS only supports FI postings (GL, AR, AP) and not all submodules. If you are testing with an unsupported posting type, ECS will not trigger.

Below references will provide further guidance

  • Upload Posting Data – Error Correction and Suspense Accounting App (F4745)
  • ECS Overview in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Here is my recommendation: Since you already raised an incident, SAP Support will confirm whether it is a template issue or a known bug in your release. In the meantime, re-download the template after your system’s last upgrade and validate all field formats against the Help Portal documentation.

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: HR Efficiency in Action: Automate and Streamline HR Processes (APAC/EMEA)
entry.content:
Is your HR team ready to boost efficiency and reduce manual workload—while delivering a better experience to employees and HR team?

Join us for an informative session on driving HR efficiency through automation, smart configuration, and mass data management. We’ll explore how to streamline hiring with tools like configurable hire templates, automatic hire, hiring from position; and mass data management—plus how AI-powered Joule is transforming employee and manager self-service.

Whether you're leading HR operations, working in HRIS, or driving digital transformation, you'll leave with actionable strategies to simplify workflows, increase productivity, and deliver scalable HR support.

Register here

entry.title: Re: How to track *usage* of ESS/MSS (not the resulting data changes)
entry.content:
Hello ,
I Don't think that is doable ? However I can think of utilizing the Workflow!

Tracing by Workflow might provide valuable insights in this scenario. For some customers I’ve worked with, they asked for unifying their Employee Self-Service (ESS) processes under a single workflow, and applying the same approach for Manager Self-Service (MSS). 

By doing so, it becomes much easier to leverage the standard reporting capabilities provided by SAP:

  • If IAS is enabled, the delivered Story Reports offer robust analytics and a clear overview of workflow activity, approval trends, and processing times.
  • If IAS is not enabled, the Canvas Standard Reports are still available, including workflow-specific datasets that support tracking and analysis.

That said, the Story Report option remains my preferred approach, as it provides a more comprehensive and insightful reporting experience.

Best of Luck!

entry.title: फ्लिपकार्ट में शिकायत कैसे करें? हेल्पलाइन नंबर 08218381537
entry.content: फ्लिपकार्ट पर शिकायत करने के लिए, फ्लिपकार्ट ऐप या वेबसाइट के "सहायता केंद्र" (Help Center) में जाएं या ग्राहक सेवा से 0821) 8381-537 पर कॉल करें. आप अपनी शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं और उन्हें ईमेल भी कर सकते हैं: grievance.officer@flipkart.com. इसके अलावा, आप ट्विटर पर @flipkartsupport पर डायरेक्ट मैसेज (DM) भेजकर भी शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं.

entry.title: In ADT, how to display compiler syntax errors inline? (in addition to the view Problems)
entry.content:
One of my colleagues can see ABAP syntax errors displayed inline in Eclipse ADT as shown below:

It even simplifies the invokation of quick fix by clicking the message:

In my case these messages are only shown in the separate Problems view (so, not inline):

What is the Eclipse or ADT setting to activate this feature?

Thank you.

Sandra

entry.title: Version support in CAP DMS Plugin
entry.content:

Siddharth

SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Document Management service

entry.title: Re: In ADT, how to display compiler syntax errors inline?...
entry.content: Here is the option to activate this nice feature in Eclipse menu > Window > Preferences > menu General > Editors > Text Editors > Show code minings for problem annotations ("None" by default, "Errors only", "Errors and Warnings", "Errors, Warnings and Infos" :
